Apply binning

Source: R/binning.R
apply_binning.Rd

Apply binning

apply_binning(bin, x, woe = FALSE)

Arguments

bin

A binning object.
x

A variable to bin.
woe

If the value is the woe instead of the categoric variable.

Examples


x <- runif(500)
y <- rbinom(500, 1, x)
bin <- binning(x, y)
xnew <- runif(50)

apply_binning(bin, xnew)
#>  [1] (0.204,0.439] (0.204,0.439] (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773]
#>  [6] (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773] (0.204,0.439] [-Inf,0.204]  (0.204,0.439]
#> [11] (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773]
#> [16] (0.204,0.439] (0.773, Inf]  (0.204,0.439] (0.773, Inf]  (0.773, Inf] 
#> [21] [-Inf,0.204]  (0.439,0.773] (0.773, Inf]  (0.773, Inf]  (0.204,0.439]
#> [26] (0.204,0.439] (0.204,0.439] (0.204,0.439] (0.204,0.439] (0.439,0.773]
#> [31] [-Inf,0.204]  (0.204,0.439] (0.773, Inf]  (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773]
#> [36] (0.773, Inf]  [-Inf,0.204]  (0.439,0.773] (0.773, Inf]  (0.439,0.773]
#> [41] (0.204,0.439] (0.773, Inf]  (0.204,0.439] [-Inf,0.204]  (0.439,0.773]
#> [46] (0.773, Inf]  (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773] (0.439,0.773] (0.204,0.439]
#> Levels: [-Inf,0.204] (0.204,0.439] (0.439,0.773] (0.773, Inf]
apply_binning(bin, xnew, woe = TRUE)
#>  [1] -0.9010590 -0.9010590  0.4847544  0.4847544  0.4847544  0.4847544
#>  [7]  0.4847544 -0.9010590 -3.3806606 -0.9010590  0.4847544  0.4847544
#> [13]  0.4847544  0.4847544  0.4847544 -0.9010590  2.0381029 -0.9010590
#> [19]  2.0381029  2.0381029 -3.3806606  0.4847544  2.0381029  2.0381029
#> [25] -0.9010590 -0.9010590 -0.9010590 -0.9010590 -0.9010590  0.4847544
#> [31] -3.3806606 -0.9010590  2.0381029  0.4847544  0.4847544  2.0381029
#> [37] -3.3806606  0.4847544  2.0381029  0.4847544 -0.9010590  2.0381029
#> [43] -0.9010590 -3.3806606  0.4847544  2.0381029  0.4847544  0.4847544
#> [49]  0.4847544 -0.9010590


data(german_credit)
x <- german_credit$purpose
y <- german_credit$good_bad
bin <- binning(x, y)
xnew <- sample(x, 50)

apply_binning(bin, xnew)
#>  [1] g_1 g_1 g_2 g_2 g_1 g_2 g_1 g_1 g_2 g_2 g_1 g_1 g_1 g_2 g_2 g_1 g_1 g_2 g_1
#> [20] g_1 g_1 g_2 g_1 g_1 g_2 g_2 g_2 g_1 g_1 g_1 g_2 g_2 g_2 g_2 g_2 g_2 g_2 g_2
#> [39] g_1 g_2 g_1 g_1 g_1 g_2 g_2 g_2 g_1 g_2 g_1 g_2
#> Levels: g_1 g_2
apply_binning(bin, xnew, woe = TRUE)
#>  [1] -0.2799201 -0.2799201  0.5136787  0.5136787 -0.2799201  0.5136787
#>  [7] -0.2799201 -0.2799201  0.5136787  0.5136787 -0.2799201 -0.2799201
#> [13] -0.2799201  0.5136787  0.5136787 -0.2799201 -0.2799201  0.5136787
#> [19] -0.2799201 -0.2799201 -0.2799201  0.5136787 -0.2799201 -0.2799201
#> [25]  0.5136787  0.5136787  0.5136787 -0.2799201 -0.2799201 -0.2799201
#> [31]  0.5136787  0.5136787  0.5136787  0.5136787  0.5136787  0.5136787
#> [37]  0.5136787  0.5136787 -0.2799201  0.5136787 -0.2799201 -0.2799201
#> [43] -0.2799201  0.5136787  0.5136787  0.5136787 -0.2799201  0.5136787
#> [49] -0.2799201  0.5136787
